clinical_study.brief_title: National Survey on the Lockdown of Children With Disabilities
clinical_study.official_title: Emerging Health Challenges for Children With Motor Disabilities and Their Parents Facing the COVID-19 Pandemic: Messages From Families Answering the ECHO French National Survey

brief_summary.textblock: During the COVID-19 pandemic, lockdown measures were established in France affecting the life course of children with disabilities. This study aimed at identifying the experiences, main difficulties and needs of these children and their parents during the lockdown period.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the 6th of April 2020 until the 11th of May 2020
primary_outcome.description: Identify the lived experience, the needs, and difficulties of children with motor disabilities and their parents during the COVID-2019 lockdown

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the 6th of April 2020 until the 11th of May 2020
primary_outcome.description: Identify the risks on health of children with motor disabilities due to the COVID-2019 lockdown

primary_outcome.measure: Impact on medical and rehabilitation follow up
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the 6th of April 2020 until the 11th of May 2020
primary_outcome.description: Identify the impact on the medical and rehabilitation follow up of children with disabilities during COVID-19 lockdown

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the 6th of April 2020 until the 11th of May 2020
primary_outcome.description: Identify the impact on the daily living of children with motor disabilities and their families during the COVID-19 lockdown

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the 24th of April 2020 until the 11th of May 2020
secondary_outcome.description: Identify the lived experience, the needs, and difficulties of children without motor disabilities and their parents during the COVID-2019 lockdown

clinical_study.condition: Identify Emerging Health Challenges for Children With Motor Disabilities and Their Parents Facing the COVID-19 Pandemic

study_pop.textblock: Children with motor disabilities, with and without associated impairement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-children (age 0-18 years) with motor disabilities (with and without associated impairement), living in France.
